column3: Hi , Have we ever donated towards any children s charity before ?
column4: Yes, I may have.
column5: Feed the Children is a great charity
column6: They value vocational education greatly which not only creates the opportunities for these young children to learn skills which can later applied in the workforce , however it also gives them a warm and positive place to live which cannot be guaranteed otherwise for some of them .
column7: I have not heard of Save the Children before.
column8: Sounds like they really help education wise.
column9: They do.
column10: But they also assist in other ways.
column11: I'm not sure if you're familiar with Hurricane Harvey that devastated part of South Texas but Save the Children is still assisting the affected children and families long after most organizations have washed their hands.
column12: Yes I have heard of Hurricane Harvey.
column13: Oh so they do more than just help with education.
column14: Thats awesome!
column15: Yes, it really is. They also provide information on their website about how funding and donations are dispersed. 86% goes to program funding, 9% to Fundraising and 5% to Management.
column16: I like that they are transparent. It adds to their credibility.
column17: I really like how they show where the funding and donations are spent.
column18: WIth some charity you never know just how much really goes to help the kids.
column19: I couldn't agree more.
column20: For me, the transparency removes all doubt towards donating.
column21: It sure does.
column22: ANything else I should know about this charity?
column23: It is a huge movement.
column24: They have helped 155million children in 120 countries.
column25: WOw, that is a lot of kids in a lot of places to help.
column26: SO what would I do if I wanted to help these kids?
column27: Today, you have a unique opportunity to donate part or all of the earnings for completing this task directly to the organization!!
column28: These kids really deserve it :)
column29: I know they really deserve but I am kinda on a tight budget right now but go ahead and tell me about this unique opportunity.
column30: You can choose anywhere from .01 to the full amount.
column31: Literally every penny helps these children.
column32: I understand being on a tight budget and needing the additional income.
column33: Just think, the impact the pennies would have on their lives is more than the impact pennies make in a more fortunate situation.
column34: Im not sure that I am so fortunate and every a penny saved is a penny earned, but I do see your point.
column35: So how would I donate if I chose to do this today?
column36: Do i pay online or how do I go about it?
column37: Very true that every penny saved is a penny earned.
column38: In comparison, these children need more help than you or I. Fortunate is perspective based but from my perspective, these kids are far less fortunate than I.
column39: The amount you choose to donate is automatically deducted today from your task payment.
column40: There's no paying online or entering payment info.
column41: It will be automatically processed for you by the requestor. :)
column42: Ok I will definitely make a donation today to Save the CHildren.
column43: YOu have convinced me that this is a great, trustworthy charity to donate to.
column45: How much of your payment would you like to donate today?
column46: As I said before, you are free to choose anywhere between .01 and the full payment amount for the task :)
column47: I will donate 0.05 cents today.
column49: You are awesome for giving your hard earned money to these kids :)
column50: I hope you have a WONDERFUL rest of your day!!

column2: Hello! How are you doing today?
column3: We doing very good thank you !
column4: How is your campaign going so ?
column5: I am doing well.
column6: Mid day has been busy visiting different places people speak about a charity they support .
column7: Have you heard of Save the Children?
column8: It sounds familiar to me, could you tell me more about it?
column9: Helping children in countries that are very war torn or in some form of conflict is what we help in.
column10: Everyday 16,000 children die before their 5th birthday, 1 out of 80 flee the country and risk everything, and 1 out of 6 kids aren't enrolled in a school or getting education that they need
column11: The charity sounds like it is doing some good work in an area that badly needs it.
column12: Children should be our top priority all across the world.
column13: How can someone get involved and help out with this charity?
column14: Oh there are quiet a few ways.
column15: For roughly a dollar a day you can sponsor a child, you can choose a gift to spend to a child through our catalog, you could start a fundraiser, or you can just simply donate.
column16: With that, keep in mind if you ever decide to make a monetary donation, 86% goes directly to the children, 9% fundraising, and 5% management and general.
column17: Just so you can have an idea that we use 9 out of 10 dollars directly on the children.
column18: I do believe I would like to donate some money to the Save the Children charity.
column19: Could I pledge $1/day to start with?
column20: absolutely thank you so much!!
column21: I like to donate money and time to charities that help children so I also want to thank you for educating me on this charity!
column22: Absolutely.
column23: I love getting the word out there on this charity.
column24: I strongly believe in it and its values on helping children.
column25: Children should be a priority in the world.
column26: They are our future.
column27: They are our future exactly.
column28: Any time I can help improve a situation for a child in need I hope to be able to do so.
column29: How long have you been supporting this charity?
column30: I have been supporting this charity for 15 years.
column31: I also must clarify with you about your donation, if you so choose too.
column32: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment today.
column33: You can choose as little as $0 all the way up to all of your payment.
column34: That being said, would you still like to donate $1 to the Save the Children charity, starting to make a difference in a childs life?
column35: I would like to start making a difference today.
column36: I would want to still donate $1 to the Save the Children charity.
column37: Thank you!
column38: That makes my heart so happy.
column39: Did you know in the first two months of 2018 alone, over 1,000 children were killed or injured seriously by violence in Syria?
column40: Just know that your donation today, and hopefully the start of more to come, will help children like this.
column41: I hate hearing about children being subjected to violence.
column42: It hurts my heart.
column43: I do hope I can help and that my small donation does some good for a child.
column45: Well that sounds just great to me!
column46: Thank you once again for your donation and feel free to spread the word about the charity to others!
column47: You are welcome and thank you for bringing my attention to such a well deserved charity!
